DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Total Cholesterol Measurement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility requirements regarding serum cholesterol levels as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Total Cholesterol Measurement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A quantitative measurement of the total amount of cholesterol present in a sample of serum._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study cholesterol less
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study cholesterol less than or equal to 300 mg/dL (7.75 mmol/L)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have serum cholesterol greater than or equal to Grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known serum cholesterol greater than or equal to Grade 2?
